name: K2-291
scenarioDescription:
The K2-291 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-291 is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.9 times its radius. It is located 294.49 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.72 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-291 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-291 system


K2-291 b

K2-291 b was discovered by the K2 observatory using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-291 b is 6.49356 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-291 b is 1.589 that of Earth. At 6.49356 Earth masses, K2-291 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-291, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by K2.
